meanings.definition: A hard, black mineral used for polishing and grinding
meanings.sent1: The jeweler used emery to make the metal shiny.
meanings.sent2: I bought a piece of emery to smooth out the rough edges.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook emery for a precious gem and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as unyielding as a block of emery.
meanings.sent5: The emery sparkled in the sunlight, revealing its true beauty.

meanings.definition: A cloth or paper coated with emery for smoothing or polishing
meanings.sent1: She used emery cloth to buff the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: The emery paper made the surface smooth to touch.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled out a never-ending roll of emery from his hat.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as abrasive as a sheet of emery.
meanings.sent5: The emery cloth worked its magic, transforming the dull metal into a gleaming surface.

meanings.definition: To polish or grind with emery
meanings.sent1: He decided to emery the rough edges of the sculpture.
meanings.sent2: She carefully emeried the surface until it shone brightly.
meanings.sent3: The chef emeried the spices together to create a flavorful blend.
meanings.sent4: Time emeried away at the memories, leaving only the essence of joy.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor emeried the marble with precision, revealing the intricate details.
